channel.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
channel.description: I'm sure this is a relatively easy question to answer but why is it my speakers know my cell phone will ring about 5 seconds before it rings? My speakers inform me by making a strange humming noise prior to me getting a call. is it something in my phone that causes my speakers phone call senses to tingle? or is it picking up some sort of secret cell phone frequency?

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:46, topic:377983”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=473873.msg3468311#msg3468311 date=1295108278]
ive often wondered what the use of robins seeing magnetic fields is, but im not a biologist

there must be some reason for it
[/quote]

They navigate by it, don’t they? I’ve read somewhere that it’s not completely clear though, they can only see it with one eye IIRC.[/quote]

Yes

Niall:

Evolutionary speaking, it wouldn’t really matter if it’s useful or not as long as the carrier has other useful genes.

There is such a thing as dormant genes/traits

Read full topic
item.source: Why are my speakers are psychic?

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

bootnecklad:

Herp a derp, don’t quote me on this but lawl hit the Niall_ on the head

With advertising like this I should go copyright the Niall_ brand of clothing, food and “self-pleasure” products!

R.I.P RSC:

Evolutionary speaking, such a sixth sense would make no sense because up until the last ~100 years we didn’t even know of their existence.

Evolutionary speaking, it wouldn’t really matter if it’s useful or not as long as the carrier has other useful genes.

Read full topic

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

i just don’t think we need to know how something works for it to work

That’s not what I was trying to say. I meant that humans don’t have a use for microwaves, in the way that Robins do have a use for magnetic fields. We need devices to ‘see’ either of them.

Read full topic
item.source: Why are my speakers are psychic?

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

i actually agree with you, i just don’t think we need to know how something works for it to work

haha, anyone remember that dude who came into #mopar once and asked how we had hydrochloric acid in our stomachs before we knew what it was?

Read full topic
item.source: Why are my speakers are psychic?

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:41, topic:377983”]but electromagnetic radiation still existed

after all robins can see magnetic fields right, and presumably their physics knowledge is not so great[/quote]

That’s true, but as far as I know humans don’t use microwaves like that. We can’t see them with our own eyes, we can’t hear them, and I doubt we can really feel them. It’s probably one of those things where you aren’t skeptical about yourself. If you predict a phone call, and nobody actually calls, you think ‘better luck next time’. But when you actually predict a phone call*, you think ‘see, I can predict it!’.

*I think it’s just a fast reaction. Like I said, people react faster to their own ringtone.

Read full topic
item.source: Why are my speakers are psychic?

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:37, topic:377983”]Scientists have said for years that there’s a sort of sixth sense that just hasn’t been unlocked or trained in the human brain, and if there really is such thing then I guess it’s possible that we’re sort of conditioning that sense every time we receive a text. The brain notices the signal, we’re rewarded by the happiness of a text(?), so that sense is developed even further

Unlikely but possible I guess[/quote]

I doubt a “sixth” sense is something that we could only use if we were technologically advanced enough to use microwaves etc. Unless we’ve evolved to have that sense.

Read full topic
item.source: Why are my speakers are psychic?

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:37, topic:377983”]Scientists have said for years that there’s a sort of sixth sense that just hasn’t been unlocked or trained in the human brain, and if there really is such thing then I guess it’s possible that we’re sort of conditioning that sense every time we receive a text. The brain notices the signal, we’re rewarded by the happiness of a text(?), so that sense is developed even further

Unlikely but possible I guess[/quote]
theres like 30 senses btw

Humans have more than five senses. Although definitions vary, the actual number ranges from 9 to more than 20. In addition to sight, smell, taste, touch, and hearing, which were the senses identified by Aristotle, humans can sense balance and acceleration (equilibrioception), pain (nociception), body and limb position (proprioception or kinesthetic sense), and relative temperature (thermoception).[115] Other senses sometimes identified are the sense of time, itching, pressure, hunger, thirst, fullness of the stomach, need to urinate, need to defecate, and blood carbon dioxide levels.

Read full topic
item.source: Why are my speakers are psychic?

Scientists have said for years that there’s a sort of sixth sense that just hasn’t been unlocked or trained in the human brain, and if there really is such thing then I guess it’s possible that we’re sort of conditioning that sense every time we receive a text. The brain notices the signal, we’re rewarded by the happiness of a text(?), so that sense is developed even further

Unlikely but possible I guess

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

When I was PAing on a set a few months ago they needed me to boom for a shot so I did.

Whenever I put my hands in certain places on the long pole, it intensified the signal and in addition to the recorded sound it also picked up a radio station.

Read full topic
item.source: Why are my speakers are psychic?

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:24, topic:377983”]I swear the human body can pickup signals and even make them stronger.

My experiences:

I wanted to shut the garage door when I was leaving the house… about 50 feet away and I am pressing the button. It will not reach the receiver. I put the end of the garage remote to my throat and press the button. It works!

Im on my computer texting all the time as well, I usually keep my phone on silent. My speakers make the static sound and I know I am getting a text or phone call. So much for silent. Sometimes I will “feel” like I got a text message and ill pull out my phone and look at there wont be a text message until about 5 seconds after.

Strange.[/quote]
You can do this kinda thing with car keys, if you’re slightly out of range you can put the key to your head the signal goes further.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I know that it’s been proven that people respond to their own ringtone much faster then any other ringtone, but that doesn’t apply here. Maybe it is possible to ‘feel’ the microwaves, which might spark another discussion about the safety of cell phone antennas.

item.title: Why are my speakers are psychic?
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

I swear the human body can pickup signals and even make them stronger.

My experiences:

I wanted to shut the garage door when I was leaving the house… about 50 feet away and I am pressing the button. It will not reach the receiver. I put the end of the garage remote to my throat and press the button. It works!

Im on my computer texting all the time as well, I usually keep my phone on silent. My speakers make the static sound and I know I am getting a text or phone call. So much for silent. Sometimes I will “feel” like I got a text message and ill pull out my phone and look at there wont be a text message until about 5 seconds after.

Strange.
